supportedFormats.title: Supported Contact Spreadsheet File Types
supportedFormats.subtitle: This tool supports a wide range of spreadsheet formats, ensuring you can easily batch import your contact data. All conversion processes are completed locally, guaranteeing privacy and security.

items.name: Excel Workbook (.xlsx)
items.desc: Compatible with standard files generated by Microsoft Excel 2007 and later. Supports reading the first sheet of all workbooks in the spreadsheet, perfectly handling Chinese data and large numbers of contact records.

items.name: Legacy Excel (.xls)
items.desc: Fully compatible with earlier versions of the Excel file format (.xls). Ensures you can directly upload and process historical data or files exported from old systems without extra format conversion.

items.name: Comma Separated Values (.csv)
items.desc: The most universal data exchange format. The tool intelligently identifies different delimiters (like commas, tabs, etc.) and encodings (UTF-8, GBK), effectively preventing garbled characters after data import.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to your questions about data security, conversion compatibility, and more.

items.q: Data Security and Privacy: Will the file be stored or leaked by the server?
items.a: Absolutely not. The core commitment of this tool is "100% Offline Conversion". Your Excel/CSV file is processed entirely within your browser's memory from upload to VCF generation, and will never pass through any external servers. This technically guarantees the absolute privacy and security of your contact information.

items.q: Chinese characters are garbled after import: Why do my contact names display as garbled code?
items.a:
The VCF files generated by this tool strictly use UTF-8 encoding, which is the international standard. Garbling is usually caused by the default encoding setting of the receiving system or application (such as some older versions of Android or Outlook).
üí° Suggestion: Import the file into modern cloud services like Apple iCloud or Google Contacts, as they automatically recognize UTF-8 encoding and ensure correct Chinese display.

items.q: Contact records lost: Why don't the number of records I converted match the number successfully imported?
items.a:
A VCF card needs to meet minimum import conditions. If your spreadsheet record is missing the Full Name / Display Name (FN) or the Mobile Number (TEL;CELL), the record will be considered invalid and skipped.
‚úÖ Solution: Please return to the converter's Step 2 (Field Mapping) and ensure these two columns in your source file are complete and correctly mapped.

items.q: VCF version selection: Which version offers the best compatibility?
items.a: We default to generating vCard version 3.0. This is currently the most widely compatible version in the industry, correctly recognized and imported by the vast majority of modern platforms and systems, including Apple iOS, Google Android, and major email services.

howItWorks.title: Three Fast Steps to Bulk Import Your Contacts
howItWorks.subtitle: Say goodbye to manual entry! Our VCF converter allows you to complete the bulk import of your Excel/CSV contact data in 3 simple, secure, and fast steps.

steps.title: Securely Upload Spreadsheet File
steps.desc:
üí° Action: Click to upload or directly drag and drop your Excel/CSV file.

We support mainstream formats like .xlsx, .xls, .csv. Rest assured, your file is processed entirely locally in the browser‚Äîno uploading, no storage, no viewing of any sensitive contact data. Your privacy and security are guaranteed.

steps.title: Accurately Map Table Columns to VCF Fields
steps.desc:
üí° Action: Match your column names (e.g., "Name", "Mobile") with the VCF standard fields (FN, TEL).

The key to this step is:
  • Required Check: Ensure the two core fields, Full Name and Mobile Number, are mapped.
  • Data Preview: View a real-time sample of the first few data entries to confirm mapping accuracy and prevent conversion errors.

steps.title: One-Click Download and Import VCF
steps.desc:
üí° Action: Click "Start Conversion" and then download the generated VCF file.

After conversion, you will get a standard VCF 3.0 file (UTF-8 encoded). You can:

  • PC: Send the VCF to your computer and bulk import via iCloud or Google Contacts.
  • Mobile: Directly import with one click on your iOS or Android device to efficiently update your contacts.

whoUse.title: Who Uses the Excel/CSV to VCF (vCard) Tool?

groups.title: Sales and Marketing Professionals
groups.desc: Attend exhibitions or export customer lists from CRM, needing to quickly import Excel/CSV customer information into phone contacts for calls, texts, and instant messaging. Core pain point: Efficiency and mobility, one-click bulk import.

groups.title: Administration and Human Resources
groups.desc: Maintain and bulk distribute employee contact lists, needing to convert the latest employee Excel to VCF to ensure uniform and accurate company contacts. Core pain point: Batch management and format accuracy.

groups.title: Tech Enthusiasts / Mobile Migrators
groups.desc: Migrating CSV exported from old devices or third-party tools to iOS/Android, where the new system only supports VCF. Core pain point: Format compatibility and garbled code resolution.

groups.title: Conference / Event Organizers
groups.desc: Before large conferences or events, need to quickly add all guest contact details to team phones for efficient communication. Core pain point: Timeliness, immediate conversion and import.

faq.q: What is a VCF/VCard file? What is its relationship with the contact book?
faq.a: VCF (Virtual Contact File), commonly known as VCard, is a standard file format used to store personal or business contact information (such as name, phone, email, address, etc.). It is the most common format for bulk importing contacts into smartphones (iOS/Android) and mainstream email clients. With our tool, you can easily meet your need for CSV to VCard (VCF) conversion.

faq.q: How do you guarantee my data security? Will the data be uploaded to a server?
faq.a: We highly value your data privacy. This tool utilizes fully local conversion technology, meaning your CSV or Excel file remains in your browser throughout the process and is never uploaded to any external server. This ensures your private data is absolutely secure, achieving a zero-leakage, risk-free conversion process.

faq.q: What is a VCF/VCard file? What is its relationship with the contact book?
faq.a: VCF (Virtual Contact File), commonly known as VCard, is the standard format for storing contact information. It is the most common format for bulk importing contacts into phones (iOS/Android) or email clients. Our tool supports efficient CSV/Excel to VCard (VCF) conversion.

faq.q: Besides CSV, is Excel (XLSX) file conversion to VCF format supported?
faq.a: Yes, our tool not only supports standard CSV to VCF conversion but is also fully compatible with Excel files (including `.xlsx` and legacy `.xls` formats). The conversion logic automatically identifies the worksheet data within the Excel file and guides you through the field mapping to achieve Excel to VCF bulk import.

seo.title: Cookie Policy
seo.description: Explanation of the types of Cookies used, their purpose, and user choices.

cookie.title: Cookie Policy
cookie.contentHtml:
This website uses cookies and similar technologies to distinguish you from other users, which helps us provide you with a better experience and allows us to improve the site.

1. Types and Purposes of Cookies

  • Strictly Necessary Cookies: These are essential for the basic functionality of the website, such as remembering your session information, locally storing your conversion history settings, etc.
  • Analytical/Performance Cookies: We use these cookies to recognize and count the number of visitors and to see how visitors use our website. This helps us understand which features are most popular (e.g., VCF to Excel or Excel to VCF) and thus improve how the website works.
  • Functionality Cookies: Used to recognize you when you return to our website, allowing us to personalize content for you and remember your preferences (for example, your language or display settings).

2. Your Choices

Most browsers allow you to manage cookie preferences. You can set your browser to refuse all or some cookies. Please note that if you choose to disable strictly necessary cookies, some features of the website may not function properly.

seo.title: Privacy Policy
seo.description: Explicit declaration that data is processed entirely locally in the browser and is not uploaded to any server.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.contentHtml:
VCF2XLS Commitment: All file conversion operations are completed in your local browser. Your file or any contact information contained within it is never uploaded, stored, or transmitted to VCF2XLS or any third-party server. The file data is destroyed as soon as you close the browser or leave the page.

1. Types of Information We Collect

Given that our service is entirely localized, we do not collect the content of the files you upload.

  • Non-Personal Information: We may use third-party analytics services (such as Google Analytics) to collect anonymous information about how you use this website, including access time, device type, browser version, and pages visited. This information is used to optimize website performance and user experience.
  • Contact Information: If you actively contact us via support email or contact form, we will only retain the email address and communication content you voluntarily provide, solely for the purpose of replying and resolving your issues.

2. Use of Information

We only use non-personal information for the following purposes:

  • Maintaining and improving the functionality and performance of the VCF2XLS website.
  • Analyzing usage trends to better understand user needs.
  • Responding to your support requests.

3. Third-Party Links

This website may contain links to third-party websites. We assume no responsibility for the privacy practices of such websites. We encourage you to read the privacy policies of any third-party website.

seo.title: Terms of Service
seo.description: Defines user rights and obligations when using this service, and disclaimers.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.contentHtml:
1. Acceptance and Use of Service

By using VCF2XLS, you agree to abide by these Terms of Service. This service is designed to provide secure, local conversion services between VCard and Excel/CSV file formats.

2. User Responsibilities

  • Data Legality: You warrant that you own or have the right to use all files (VCF, Excel, CSV) and the data contained therein uploaded for conversion. You must not use this service to process illegal, infringing, or protected materials.
  • Assumption of Risk: Although this service strives for conversion accuracy, you understand and agree that format differences may exist during the conversion process. You are responsible for checking and verifying the converted data before importing it into any system.

3. Disclaimer of Warranties

The Service is provided on an ‚Äúas is‚Äù and ‚Äúas available‚Äù basis. VCF2XLS does not warrant that the service will be uninterrupted, error-free, or completely accurate. We expressly disclaim responsibility for any direct, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from the use or inability to use the service, including but not limited to loss of data or loss of profit.

4. Intellectual Property

This website, its source code, design, logo (VCF2XLS), and all content are owned by VCF2XLS and are protected by copyright law.

faqPage.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faqPage.subtitle: Quick answers to your questions about data security, conversion compatibility, and more.
faqPage.q1: Will my VCF or Excel file be uploaded to a server?
faqPage.a1: Absolutely not. The core advantage of VCF2XLS is that data is processed entirely in your local browser. File content never leaves your device, thus ensuring the highest level of data privacy and security.
faqPage.q2: What should I do if Chinese characters are garbled after importing to my phone?
faqPage.a2: Garbling usually occurs during the Excel/CSV to VCF conversion process. Please ensure your original CSV file is saved with UTF-8 encoding. The VCF files generated by our tool also default to UTF-8 encoding, which is the standard method for resolving Chinese character set issues. If the problem persists, try reopening the CSV in Excel, saving it as UTF-8 format, and re-uploading.
faqPage.q3: After VCF to Excel conversion, are some fields like "Notes" or "multiple phone numbers" lost?
faqPage.a3:
Our tool's parser is designed to identify and extract all standard and non-standard fields in VCF.
  • For multiple identical fields (such as two mobile numbers), we will either merge them into the same cell or create separate columns in Excel (such as "Phone 1", "Phone 2").
  • If your VCF contains non-standard data, please send the VCF file to us for analysis, and we will update the parsing logic as soon as possible to support that field.
faqPage.q4: Are there any limits on file size or the number of contacts?
faqPage.a4: Since the conversion is done locally, the file size primarily depends on your device's performance (CPU and memory). Theoretically, there are no strict limits, but processing VCF files with over 50,000 contacts may take a significant amount of time, so please be patient.

changelog.title: Product Update Log
changelog.intro: We are committed to continuously improving the conversion accuracy and user experience of VCF2XLS.

v2.title: V2.0.0 - Bidirectional Conversion Engine Officially Released
v2.p1: New Feature: Introduced the VCF file parsing engine, enabling the reverse conversion function of VCF ‚Üí Excel/CSV.
v2.p2: New Feature: Supports VCF 4.0 specification, fully extracting complex fields like address, organization, and notes.
v2.p3: Optimization & Improvement: Optimized the field mapping interface for the Excel ‚Üí VCF process, supporting more custom labels.
v2.p4: Optimization & Improvement: Performance enhancement, local processing speed for large data files (10k+ contacts) increased by 30%.

v1_1.title: V1.1.0 - CSV Garbled Code Fix and Compatibility Enhancement
v1_1.p1: Optimization & Improvement: Forced VCF file export to use UTF-8 encoding, completely resolving Chinese character set garbling issues.
v1_1.p2: Bug Fix: Fixed an issue where column headers could not be correctly identified when uploading specific Excel version (XLS) files.

v1_0.title: V1.0.0 - Initial Release
v1_0.p1: New Feature: Implemented basic Excel/CSV ‚Üí VCF conversion function.
v1_0.p2: New Feature: Implemented local processing to ensure data security.
